messages.content: You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
When is the best time to sow sorghum in Madhya Pradesh?
For maximum yield, sow sorghum one month before the arrival of the monsoon. Early sowing reduces pest pressure, especially from stem fly.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
My area has low rainfall. Is sorghum suitable for such conditions?
Yes, sorghum is highly suitable for areas with low rainfall (450–500 mm) and is known for drought tolerance.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How much seed should I use per hectare for sorghum?
For one hectare, 8–10 kg of healthy, high-germination seed is sufficient for optimal plant stand.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I control weeds in my sorghum field?
Practice two rounds of intercultivation at 15–20 and 30–35 days after sowing. For chemical control, use atrazine (0.5–1.0 kg active ingredient per hectare) in 500 liters of water pre-emergence.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What fertilizers and quantity should I apply for sorghum?
Apply 80kg nitrogen, 40kg phosphorus, and 40kg potash per hectare. Give half nitrogen and full P & K at sowing, the rest of N 30–35 days after sowing.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the best way to prevent stem borer in sorghum?
Sow early to avoid stem fly, and at sowing, apply carbofuran granules (10% granules, 12–15kg/ha) below the seed. Monitor for leaf holes and destroy affected plants.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Should I use organic manure for sorghum?
Yes, apply 5 tonnes of well-decomposed cow dung manure per hectare for improved yield and soil fertility.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What plant population do I need for high sorghum yields?
Maintain about 180,000 plants/ha for normal varieties and up to 210,000 for high-yielding hybrids. Adjust row and plant spacing accordingly.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
My field has a history of smut disease. How can I prevent it?
Treat seed with thiram (3g/kg) or carbendazim (1.5g/kg) before sowing. Adopt crop rotation and destroy crop residues to prevent recurrence.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I control shoot fly in my sorghum crop?
Sow ahead of the monsoon, treat seeds with Furodon 50SP (100g/10kg seed), and apply granules in the soil at planting. Remove and destroy 'dead heart' plants to reduce the pest population.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Which intercrops are best with sorghum?
Soybean and tuvar (pigeonpea) do well as intercrops with sorghum, giving extra income and better resource use. Maintain proper spacing.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I protect my sorghum crop from midge fly?
Destroy crop residues, use resistant varieties, and spray malathion (1 litre/ha in 500–600 litres water) at 90% panicle emergence. Repeat if needed after 10–15 days.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
There is black mold on my sorghum grains at harvest. What should I do?
Black or pink mold appears when rains coincide with grain ripening. Spray Dithane M-45 (0.3%) three times: at swelling, milk stage, and dough stage if rainy weather persists.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the best harvesting time for sorghum?
Harvest sorghum at physiological maturity. Cut plants, pile them up, then separate and dry the panicle for grain storage when moisture is 10–12%.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I manage Anthracnose in my sorghum crop?
Treat seeds with thiram (3g/kg) or carbendazim (1.5g/kg), spray mancozeb (3g/litre), and rotate crops. Use resistant hybrids if available.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Is it necessary to do crop rotation with sorghum?
Yes. Crop rotation helps prevent disease and pest build-up, ensuring healthy yields year after year.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
The leaves of my sorghum crop are turning yellow. What could be the cause?
Yellowing might be due to nutrient deficiencies, waterlogging, or early downy mildew infection. Apply balanced fertilizers, avoid overwatering, and monitor for disease symptoms.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I control armyworm infestations in sorghum?
Dig trenches around the field to prevent entry and spray dimethoate or methyl demeton if larvae populations cross economic thresholds. Inspect fields regularly.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I increase organic matter content in my soil for better sorghum yields?
Add green manure at 6 tons/ha or compost/cow dung as available before sowing. This improves soil health and productivity.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What are the symptoms and control of charcoal rot in sorghum?
Symptoms include dried central stems and black sclerosia. Control by treating seeds, rotating crops, and maintaining good field hygiene to avoid moisture stress.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can I grow sorghum on heavy clay or loamy soils?
Yes, sorghum can be grown well on soils with a pH of 6.0 to 8.0, including clayey, loamy, or moderately deep, well-drained soils.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What’s the benefit of using treated seeds for sorghum?
Seed treatment prevents seed-borne diseases and early pest damage, leading to improved germination, healthy seedlings, and better yields.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I maintain the right plant population during sowing?
Maintain about 180,000 plants per ha by spacing rows 45 cm apart and plants 12 cm apart. Adjust seed rate and thin extra plants after emergence if needed.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Which new high-yield hybrid varieties of sorghum are recommended?
Recommended hybrids include Jawahar Jowar 1022, Jawahar Jowar 1041, and CSH 18. These offer good yields and disease resistance.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I ensure proper germination of sorghum seeds?
Use fresh, healthy seeds with at least 70-75% germination. Treat with fungicide and biofertilizers before sowing, and sow after good pre-monsoon rainfall to ensure moisture.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Why is early sowing of sorghum important?
Early sowing, before the monsoon, boosts yield by about 23% and reduces stem fly pest damage.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
When should I apply the second dose of nitrogen in sorghum?
Apply the remaining half of nitrogen 30–35 days after sowing, when plants are about 10–12 cm tall for better development.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the benefit of including sorghum in an intercropping system?
Intercropping sorghum with legumes like soybean or tuvar increases total yield, improves soil fertility, and provides income stability.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I manage angia (earhead) disease in sorghum?
Manage angia by spraying sodium salt of 2,4-D (2kg/ha) and destroying diseased plants early. Practice crop rotation and field sanitation.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Is it necessary to soak sorghum seeds before sowing?
Soaking is not usually required, but treat seeds with biofertilizers and fungicides before sowing to improve germination and health.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What are the signs of shoot bug in sorghum and how do I manage it?
Shoot bug causes yellowing, shriveling leaves, and sticky secretions. Deep summer ploughing, residue destruction, and soil-applied carbofuran help control it.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can sorghum tolerate temporary flooding?
Yes, sorghum can withstand short periods of waterlogging better than many other cereals, but avoid prolonged inundation.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Is sorghum suitable for making ethanol?
Yes, sorghum grain is increasingly used for high-quality alcohol and ethanol production in addition to feed and food uses.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What precautions should I take at grain storage after sorghum harvest?
Dry sorghum grain to 10–12% moisture before storage to prevent mold and insect infestation. Store in clean, dry, and airtight containers.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What are the symptoms and management of downy mildew in sorghum?
Symptoms are yellowing leaves with white streaks; plants remain weak. Treat seeds with metalaxyl, spray mancozeb, grow resistant varieties, and destroy infected plants.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Should I fertilize if I use plenty of organic manure?
Yes, while organic manure improves soil health, supplement with chemical fertilizer as per recommendations for best yields.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I improve the dry fodder yield from my sorghum crop?
Harvest at physiological maturity and leave the stalks to dry before stacking for fodder. Sorghum offers both quality grains and nutritious fodder for livestock.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
When is spraying pesticides justified in sorghum crops?
Spray pesticides only when pest numbers cross economic threshold levels. Monitor fields regularly and use recommended pesticides for specific pests.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What does 'dead heart' in sorghum mean?
'Dead heart' refers to withering and death of the central shoot, often caused by stem borer or shoot fly larvae boring into the growing point of young plants.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I prevent leaf rust in sorghum?
Leaf rust appears as brown spots on the lower side of leaves. Control with mancozeb spray (3g/litre) at regular intervals; keep field clean and rotate crops.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can sorghum survive in drought-prone areas?
Sorghum is very drought-tolerant and a good choice for rainfed or dry areas, as it can make use of limited water efficiently.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What cultural practices help reduce insect pests in sorghum fields?
Practices like early sowing, deep ploughing, residue destruction, crop rotation, and removing infested plants all help in reducing pest loads naturally.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I protect my sorghum crop during heavy rains at grain filling?
Use well-drained fields, timely sowing, and choose varieties with disease resistance. Apply fungicide sprays if mold risk is high.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Why is plant spacing important in sorghum cultivation?
Proper spacing (45 cm between rows and 10-12 cm between plants) ensures healthy crop development, maximum light interception, and reduces competition for nutrients.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can I mix other crops with sorghum for better profit?
Yes, intercropping sorghum with soybean, tuvar, or other legumes increases overall returns and soil fertility, but maintain advised spacing.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What’s a good strategy for weed management in sorghum?
Do two rounds of weeding at 15–20 and 30–35 days after sowing; supplement with atrazine pre-emergence or alachlor in mixed cropping for effective control.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How much yield can I expect from sorghum in Madhya Pradesh?
With recommended practices, average sorghum yields in MP can be about 27% higher than typical regional averages. Actual yield depends on weather, practice, and input use.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Are there any hybrid sorghum varieties that mature quickly?
Yes, new hybrids mature in about 95–110 days, letting you avoid late-season diseases and improve double cropping options.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
If I experience sudden pest outbreak, should I harvest early?
Assess the severity. For heavy above-ground pest attack, early harvest may help reduce grain loss, but always consult an agri expert before premature cutting.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the economic threshold level for spraying against sorghum shoot fly?
Spray insecticides if 10% of plants show dead heart, or there is one egg per plant on 10% of plants. Monitor and act promptly at threshold.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What are the main uses for harvested sorghum grain?
Sorghum grain is used for food, fodder, and industrial products like alcohol and ethanol. The straw is valuable as livestock feed.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I recognize powdery mildew in my sorghum field?
Powdery mildew appears as white, powdery patches on the surfaces of leaves. Apply recommended fungicides when detected and remove heavily infected plants.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What soil pH is best suited for sorghum cultivation?
Sorghum grows best in soils with pH ranging from 6.0 to 8.0, which includes loamy, moderately deep, and well-drained soils.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can sorghum tolerate short-term flooding?
Yes, sorghum can withstand temporary submergence in its early growth stages, but prolonged flooding should be avoided as it reduces yield.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the recommended method for field preparation before sorghum sowing?
Deep plowing during summer is recommended, ideally once every 3 years, using tractor or bullock-powered implements for better soil aeration, fertility and weed control.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Is there a benefit to using microbial cultures during seed treatment?
Yes, applying biofertilizer cultures like Azospirillum along with fungicide treatments enhances nutrient availability and can increase sorghum yield by over 17%.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How many seeds per hill should I space for optimal sorghum yields?
Use spacing of 45 cm between rows and 10-12 cm between plants, arriving at about 180,000 plants per hectare for best yields.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What insecticides should I use to protect sorghum seeds during sowing?
Apply chlorpyrifos powder at 2% concentration, using 20-25 kg per hectare as seed treatment to prevent early insect infestations.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I minimize yield losses due to stem borer in sorghum?
Practice early sowing, treat seeds with insecticides, and apply carbofuran granules near planting. Monitor for larval activity and remove infested plants.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What are the symptoms of shoot fly damage in sorghum?
Shoot fly larvae bore into the growing point causing 'dead heart' symptom - central leaf whorl dries and turns brown, resulting in stunted or dead plants.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Which sorghum varieties are suitable for cultivation in hard clay soils?
Varieties adapted to Malwa and Madhya Pradesh regions with heavy clay soils include Jawahar Jowar 1022 and 1041, as well as other recommended hybrids by local agricultural universities.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How often should I irrigate sorghum under irrigated conditions?
Apply 5-6 irrigations during the growing season, at critical stages such as tillering, flowering, and grain filling, depending on soil moisture and rainfall.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can we use sprinkler irrigation for sorghum?
Yes, sprinkler irrigation is useful especially in water-scarce areas; it facilitates uniform water distribution and can improve water use efficiency.

What is the recommended fertilizer dosage for sorghum?
Apply 80 kg nitrogen, 40 kg phosphorus and 40 kg potash per hectare. Apply half the nitrogen and full P and K at sowing, then side dress the remaining nitrogen at 30–35 days.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How much compost or manure should I add to my sorghum fields?
Apply 5 tonnes of well-decomposed cow dung or compost per hectare to improve soil fertility and enhance yields.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What cultural practices help reduce insect pest incidence in sorghum?
Deep plowing in summer, destroying crop residues, early sowing, and crop rotation help reduce pest incidence significantly.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Are there sorghum varieties resistant to major diseases?
Yes, some new hybrids and improved varieties have shown resistance to leaf diseases like anthracnose and rusts. Use certified seeds of such varieties.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Which pests affect sorghum during its flowering phase?
The sorghum midge (Contarinia sorghicola) attacks during flowering by laying eggs in florets, and larvae damage developing grains.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the best way to monitor midge population in sorghum?
Monitor at flowering stage; when 5 midges per panicle are found or 10% panicle infestation occurs, apply recommended insecticides.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What insecticides are recommended for control of sorghum stem borer?
Use carbofuran granules during sowing and spray systemic insecticides such as carbaryl or malathion during peak larval activity.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I prevent charcoal rot in sorghum?
Maintain adequate soil moisture, avoid water stress, use resistant varieties, and treat seeds with fungicides to prevent charcoal rot.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How can I identify anthracnose disease in my sorghum crop?
Look for round to elliptical leaf spots with dark borders and gray centers, which increase in number and cause leaf drying.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What is the crop rotation benefit for sorghum cultivation?
Crop rotation reduces pests and disease buildup, improves soil health, and breaks pathogen cycles thereby enhancing sustainability.

What is the recommended spacing for sorghum and tuvar intercropping?
Use 45 cm row spacing for sorghum with 1-2 rows of tuvar spaced between sorghum rows at 100 cm, optimizing area and complementary growth.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What harvesting practice ensures high quality sorghum grain?
Harvest at physiological maturity, dry the panicles until grain moisture reaches around 10-12%, then thresh carefully to prevent grain damage.

What plant population is recommended for hybrid sorghum varieties?
Maintain about 210,000 plants per hectare for hybrid varieties, with row spacing of 45 cm and 10 cm between plants for optimal yield.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What role does organic mulching play in sorghum cultivation?
Mulching conserves soil moisture, suppresses weeds, and can improve soil fertility through gradual microbial decomposition.

How can excessive nitrogen application affect sorghum crops?
Excess nitrogen can cause lush vegetative growth that attracts pests like armyworms and reduces grain filling, ultimately lowering yield quality.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
What precautions should be taken to avoid grain mold in sorghum?
Avoid late-season rains by timely sowing, select resistant varieties, and apply fungicides during grain maturation if rainy conditions persist.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How does early sowing reduce pest losses in sorghum?
Early sowing helps the crop escape peak insect population periods such as shoot fly and stem borer, thereby minimizing damage.

How do I treat sorghum seeds with biofertilizers properly?
Treat seeds with an appropriate fungicide and then coat with Azospirillum culture before drying and sowing for maximum effect.

What are the warning signs of stem borer infestation?
Look for bored holes in stems, frass (insect droppings), dead hearts in young plants, and wilting of attacked tillers.

Which fungicides are recommended for leaf spot diseases in sorghum?
Use fungicides such as carbendazim and mancozeb sprayed at intervals during disease favorable conditions.

What are the effects of heat stress on sorghum during grain filling?
High temperatures during grain filling decrease kernel size and weight, reducing overall yield and quality.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
Can sorghum fields with heavy weeds be chemically managed?
Yes, herbicides like atrazine, alachlor, and 2,4-D can be used following recommended dosages to control broadleaf and grassy weeds.
You are a friendly and knowledgeable agriculture expert advising farmers.
How do I dispose of sorghum crop residues to reduce pests next season?
Burn or bury crop residues to destroy pests and pathogens that survive on old plant material.

For maximum yield, sow sorghum one month before the arrival of the monsoon. Early sowing helps reduce pest pressure, especially from stem fly.

Yes, sorghum is highly suitable for areas with low rainfall (450–500 mm) and is known for excellent drought tolerance.

Use 8 to 10 kilograms of healthy seed per hectare to achieve optimum plant population and good yields.

How do I manage weeds in my sorghum field?
Perform weeding twice—once between 15-20 days after sowing and again at 30-35 days. Additionally, use atrazine (0.5-1.0 kg a.i./ha) sprayed before weed emergence for chemical control.

What fertilizers should I apply for sorghum cultivation?

Apply 80 kg nitrogen, 40 kg phosphorus, and 40 kg potash per hectare. Half the nitrogen along with full phosphorus and potash should be applied at sowing, with the remaining nitrogen side-dressed after 30-35 days.

How do I protect sorghum from stem borer attacks?
Treat seeds with insecticides like carbofuran and apply granular insecticides near sowing. Ensure early sowing and timely monitoring to keep the pest under control.

What benefits do microbial seed treatments offer for sorghum?
Using microbial cultures such as Azospirillum along with fungicide treatment on seeds improves nutrient availability and can boost yields by up to 17.6%.

Maintain approximately 180,000 plants per hectare for general varieties and about 210,000 plants per hectare for hybrids by adjusting spacing accordingly.

How do I manage sorghum shoot fly?
Increase seed rate during sowing to reduce damage, treat seeds with insecticides like Furodan, and remove and destroy infested plants to suppress pest buildup.

Yes, sprinkler irrigation is suitable, especially in areas with limited water, offering efficient and uniform water distribution.

How do I increase sorghum yield under drought conditions?
Ensure early sowing, use drought-tolerant varieties, apply recommended fertilizers, and adopt moisture-conservation practices like mulching or improved tillage.

What is the right time and method for sorghum harvesting?
Harvest at physiological maturity, cut and dry the crop appropriately to reduce grain moisture to about 10%, then thresh carefully to ensure high-quality grain.

How to manage weeds chemically in sorghum?
Use pre-emergent herbicides like atrazine or alachlor at recommended doses. For grassy and broadleaf weeds, combine chemical control with cultural practices.

What symptoms indicate sorghum midge infestation?
Presence of larvae inside flower heads causing poor grain formation and shredding of florets. Monitoring insect levels guides treatment decisions.

How frequently should I spray fungicides on sorghum for disease control?
Spray fungicides such as mancozeb and carbendazim at intervals of 10-15 days the first time at disease onset, then repeat based on severity and crop stage.

Are there sorghum varieties resistant to common diseases?
Yes, improved hybrids and varieties have resistance to many diseases like anthracnose, rusts, and smuts. Using certified seed is always advised.

What is the impact of high temperatures on sorghum grain development?
Extreme heat during grain filling reduces kernel size and weight, causing reduced yield and quality.

How can crop rotation help in sorghum cultivation?
Rotation breaks disease and pest cycles, improves soil fertility, and sustains productivity over time.

Which pests commonly attack sorghum and how to identify them?
Shoot fly, stem borer, and midge are common pests. Look for symptoms like dead hearts, stem tunnels, and damaged flower heads, respectively.

How should I space crops in a sorghum-legume intercropping system?
Maintain 45 cm between sorghum rows, with 2 rows of legumes like soybean or tuvar placed in between at 30 to 45 cm spacing.

What cultural steps reduce insect pressure in sorghum?
Adopt early sowing, remove infected plants, deep plowing, clean field sanitation, and crop rotations to manage pest populations naturally.

What storage practices help keep sorghum grain safe after harvest?
Dry grain to safe moisture levels below 12%, store in clean, dry, pest-proof containers, and maintain storage hygiene to reduce losses.

How do I recognize charcoal rot disease in sorghum?
Look for blackened, hollow stems with drying of the central tissue, often causing stalk breakage and plant lodging.

What practices help mitigate downy mildew in sorghum?
Use resistant varieties, treat seed with fungicides like metalaxyl, remove diseased plants promptly, and follow crop rotations.

Apply malathion spray at 1 liter per hectare during early panicle emergence and repeat as necessary at 10-15 day intervals.

Can sorghum be grown on heavy clay soils?
Yes, sorghum can be grown on well-drained heavy clay soils with appropriate management to prevent waterlogging.

How do I avoid yield reduction due to water stress in sorghum?
Maintain moisture with irrigation or moisture conservation practices, and avoid prolonged drought during critical growth stages like flowering.

Key pests include shoot fly, stem borer, and midge. Control with seed treatment, timely spraying, removal of infected plants, and using resistant varieties.

Apply 80 kg nitrogen per hectare, split between half at sowing and half as side dressing after 30-35 days.

When should I apply phosphorous and potassium fertilizers in sorghum?
Apply the full recommended dose of phosphorus (40 kg/ha) and potassium (40 kg/ha) at sowing for optimum nutrient availability.

What is the role of compost in sorghum cultivation?
Compost improves soil fertility, texture, and moisture retention, leading to increased yields and sustainable soil health.

How do I identify and control anthracnose in sorghum?
Anthracnose appears as dark spots on leaves; control by using resistant varieties, seed treatment, and fungicide applications.

What are the effects of late sowing on sorghum?
Late sowing can increase pest and disease pressure and reduce yields due to adverse climatic conditions during critical growth phases.
